thread.title: Man accused of shooting AR-15 rifle at cows along Florida's Turnpike
thread.title_full: Man accused of shooting AR-15 rifle at cows along Florida's Turnpike - Orlando Sentinel

author: orlandosentinel.com
title: Man accused of shooting AR-15 rifle at cows along Florida's Turnpike
text:
A man was arrested Saturday after being accused of shooting at cows along Florida's Turnpike, according to the Florida Highway Patrol.
Troopers got a call from a driver about 5:40 p.m. about a man "hanging out of a car shooting a rifle at cows" near Osceola Parkway, an arrest report states.
The driver took down the license plate number of the Hyundai Sonata, and within minutes troopers pulled the vehicle over in Orange County and found three people inside.
Elvis Antonio Artola, 30, first started firing when the trio pulled over to relieve themselves along the turnpike, troopers said. He continued shooting from a window in the back seat as they drove down the highway, an arrest affidavit said.
Artola wouldn't tell troopers what happened, but the two passengers told them Artola was firing into woods and out the window as they drove, records show. Troopers say they found evidence that he'd been drinking alcohol.

Caption Winter Park residents ring in 2017 with a warm Polar Plunge With a forecast high of 82-degrees, Winter Park residents gathered at the Cady Way Pool for a warm-weather Polar Plunge at noon on January 1, 2017. Following a short opening ceremony to mark the ninth annual event, participants dove into the deep end of the 50-meter pool operated by the YMCA. The annual event is meant to promote “advocacy, awareness of the facility itself and the things it does for the community,” said Curt Klausner, Aquatics Director at YMCA of Central Florida. (Jordan Krumbine / Orlando Sentinel)
With a forecast high of 82-degrees, Winter Park residents gathered at the Cady Way Pool for a warm-weather Polar Plunge at noon on January 1, 2017. Following a short opening ceremony to mark the ninth annual event, participants dove into the deep end of the 50-meter pool operated by the YMCA. The annual event is meant to promote “advocacy, awareness of the facility itself and the things it does for the community,” said Curt Klausner, Aquatics Director at YMCA of Central Florida. (Jordan Krumbine / Orlando Sentinel)

It's been 10 years since Justin Bieber uploaded his first YouTube video and Britney Spears had a major meltdown. What else happened a decade ago?
The driver said he wasn't sure whether Artola "was trying to hit the cows on the side of the road or if he was just shooting," and arrest report states.
Troopers found a loaded black Bushmaster AR-15 rifle in the trunk of the vehicle along with evidence it recently had been fired. Florida Highway Patrol Sgt. Kim Montes said troopers haven't been notified of any injured cows.
"It's a good thing this driver called this in and was able to take down the plate number because we were able to get there quickly and prevent this guy from doing this again," Montes said.
From mass slayings to strange attacks, these are pictures of the most bizarre and shocking crimes to happen in Florida.
Artola is facing a number of charges, including firing a weapon in public and using a firearm under the influence.
